text: Çağla Akalın (born 17 June 1990) is a Turkish actress, model, columnist, singer, and human rights activist. In 2013, she became the first trans beauty pageant title holder at the Miss Queen competition for transsexuals in Turkey. She is also Turkey's first transsexual model. In 2013, she revealed in an interview with Hürriyet that she had chosen her first name and surname after model Çağla Şıkel and singer Demet Akalın, respectively. In 2015, with her role in the movie Köpek, Akalın became Turkey's first transsexual actress to get a leading role. == References == == External links == * * Category:Living people Category:1990 births Category:Turkish film actresses Category:LGBT rights activists from Turkey Category:LGBT people from Turkey Category:Transgender and transsexual actresses
title: Çağla Akalın
